page.title: 02Why Seaton Delaval?
page.content: The{history}of Seaton Delaval can be traced back to the Norman Conquest of 1066, when{Hamon de la Val}was given land for his service to Duke William. In 1719{Admiral George Delaval}bought the Seaton Delaval estate and had a hall designed by{Sir John Vanburgh. The hall was completed in 1728. The { {Avenue Head,}which is now the centre of the town, is so called because it used to be the entrance to the drive of Seaton Delaval Hall. The{Delaval family}had an interesting history. They thought that there was a {curse}on the family. In 1711, Francis Delaval, the nephew of Admiral George Delaval, inherited Ford Castle in the north of Northumberland. When Admiral George Delaval died in 1723, the estate of Seaton Delaval was left to Francis, and at this point, the curse came into effect.
